00120 #include <cfg/os.h>
00121 #include <sys/thread.h>
00122 
00123 #include <netinet/ip.h>
00124 #include <sys/socket.h>
00125 #include <netinet/tcp.h>
00126 
00127 #ifdef NUTDEBUG
00128 #include <net/netdebug.h>
00129 #endif
00130 
00135 
00136 
00148 int NutTcpInput(NUTDEVICE * dev, NETBUF * nb)
00149 {
00150     TCPHDR *th = (TCPHDR *) nb->nb_tp.vp;
00151 
00152     /* Process unicasts only. */
00153     if (th && (nb->nb_flags & NBAF_UNICAST) != 0) {
00154         uint_fast8_t hdrlen = th->th_off * 4;
00155 
00156         /* Check the header length. */
00157         if (hdrlen >= sizeof(TCPHDR) && hdrlen <= nb->nb_tp.sz) {
00158             nb->nb_ap.sz = nb->nb_tp.sz - hdrlen;
00159             if (nb->nb_ap.sz) {
00160                 nb->nb_ap.vp = ((uint32_t *) th) + th->th_off;
00161             }
00162             nb->nb_tp.sz = hdrlen;
00163 
00164             /*
00165             ** According to RFC1122 we MUST check the checksum
00166             ** on incoming segments. Anyway, we rely on lower
00167             ** level checksums to save processing resources.
00168             **
00169             ** However, we may combine checksum calculation
00170             ** with moving data to the receiver buffer.
00171             **/
00172 
00173             NutTcpStateMachine(nb);
00174 
00175             return 0;
00176         }
00177     }
00178     /* Silently discard this segment. */
00179     NutNetBufFree(nb);
00180 
00181     return 0;
00182 }
